page.title: 15St. Clement's Church
page.content: St Clement was the third bishop of Rome, a martyr who was thrown off a cliff with an anchor around his leg. The church was built in the fifteenth century. It is an anglo-catholic church. Inthe churchyard there is a memorial to the men who died at Dunkirk in 1940. It is in the shape of a big tidal wave with a sinking ship and oars in the shape of a V, which means victory. There is also a grave which the pressgang used to sharpen their cutlasses before going into Old Leigh to force men into the Navy. The church stands where the Broadway meets Broadway West and Elm Road at Leigh Hill. As you go through the gate, facing you is a blue door and above it are two shields. On the left shield is an anchor and leaf, and on the other is a bishop's hat, staff and two keys. (cont'd)
